thread.title: CM for friendly ties with Pak
thread.title_full: CM for friendly ties with Pak

author: tribuneindia.com
title: CM for friendly ties with Pak
text:
Ehsan Fazili
Tribune News Service
Pahalgam, October 1
Taking a cue from former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee’s approach to have friendly relations with neighbours, Chief Minister Mufti Mohammad Sayeed today urged India to have friendly relations with Pakistan, saying ,“Neighbours cannot be changed.”“I can firmly say that Jammu and Kashmir is the most peaceful place,” Mufti said while addressing the gathering after inaugurating the Pahalgam Club in south Kashmir. Describing Vajpayee as a statesman, Mufti recalled the former Prime Minister’s oft-Quote: d assertion that friends could be changed, but not neighbours. He stressed the need for peaceful and good neighbourly relations with Pakistan. “India has to be friendly with its neighbours,” Mufti said. He expressed the hope that the two countries would usher in an era of peace and development. He favoured dialogue between the two countries to ensure a peaceful atmosphere in the region, saying Jammu and Kashmir had passed through difficulties over the past more than two decades of militancy. The Chief Minister admitted that questions were being raised over the PDP’s alliance with the BJP, saying, “What has Modi given to Mufti?” The Chief Minister asserted that it was a phase of “transformation, change and development” and six months was not time enough to determine the performance of any government. He held that many developments had taken place during the past six months and the state was moving forward on the path of peace and development.
